result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M. Reible was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT WITH CURRENT PROBATION

miscConds.notes: COMPLY WITH ANY COUNSELING RECOMMENDED BY THE AGENT

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M. Reible

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin M. Reible not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was never booked on this case.  Clerk sent a letter dated May 8th to the defendant stating that he would have to be booked before this date.  
Atty Hendee will look into the matter.

BY THE COURT:  Atty Hendee will check if booking was done.
Letter from the Court to Mr. Reible to appear for booking by May 20th.

Defendant Kevin M. Reible in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was on the calendar for tomorrow but Mr. Reible is here today and there is resolution.  
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions; concurrent with his current probation.
Court Costs = $243.00
Comply with any counseling recommended by the Agent

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests $250 cash bond.  Defendant requests high signature bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets cash bond.  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.  Court questions defendant on his waiver of counsel.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds waiver of counsel made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.

Defendant Kevin M. Reible by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant on his failure to appear.  Defendant states he made calls on his previous case that he wouldn't be able to get here to turn himself in and serve his sentence.  BY THE COURT:  Previous warrant deemed satisfied.  Return date scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
